criteria: Explanation of Risks Associated with Hazards
descriptions: The student does not identify any safety hazards related to Internet usage.
The student identifies one safety hazard related to Internet usage but lacks detail.
The student identifies two safety hazards related to Internet usage with some detail.
The student identifies three safety hazards related to Internet usage with reasonable detail.
The student identifies four safety hazards related to Internet usage with good detail and examples.
The student comprehensively identifies multiple safety hazards related to Internet usage with specific examples and demonstrates a thorough understanding.
The student does not explain any risks associated with Internet safety hazards.
The student vaguely mentions risks associated with one Internet safety hazard.
The student explains the risks associated with one or two Internet safety hazards with limited clarity.
The student explains the risks associated with several Internet safety hazards with reasonable clarity.
The student clearly explains the risks associated with multiple Internet safety hazards, providing relevant context.
The student comprehensively explains the risks associated with various Internet safety hazards, demonstrating a deep understanding of potential consequences.
The student does not discuss any preventative measures for Internet safety hazards.
The student mentions one vague preventative measure.
The student discusses one or two basic preventative measures with limited explanation.
The student discusses several preventative measures with reasonable explanation.
The student clearly discusses multiple preventative measures, explaining their effectiveness.
The student comprehensively discusses a wide range of preventative measures, critically evaluating their effectiveness and suggesting improvements.
